headline.main: BROADWAY MURRAY'S NEAR TIMES SQUARE; Restaurateur Follows the Lights and Leases a Building for a Hotel and Eating House.

docs.abstract: J L Murray takes 21-yr lease on old Albany Apts, Bway-51st St, to convert them into hotel and restaurant
docs.lead_paragraph: Following the movement toward Broadway in Times Square and directly north of it of the hotel and restaurant life of the city, John L. Murray, the restaurateur, has taken a twenty-one-year lease on the old Albany Apartments on the west side of Broadway between Fiftyfirst and Fifty-second Streets.
docs.snippet: Following the movement toward Broadway in Times Square and directly north of it of the hotel and restaurant life of the city, John L. Murray, the restaurateur, has taken a twenty-one-year lease on the old Albany Apartments on the west side of Broa...

headline.main: HOTEL ROOF GARDENS PREPARING TO OPEN; Plaza Opens Its Summer Garden on the Ground Floor Next Wednesday Night.

docs.abstract: NYC hotels prepare to open roof and summer gardens
docs.lead_paragraph: Preparations are being hastened at many of the big hotels for the formal opening of the roof and summer gardens, but the only definite announcements so far made are by the Plaza and Knickerbocker Hotels. The summer garden at the Plaza will open nest Wednesday night, and Armenonville at the Knickerbocker will be thrown open on June 1, weather permitting.
docs.snippet: Preparations are being hastened at many of the big hotels for the formal opening of the roof and summer gardens, but the only definite announcements so far made are by the Plaza and Knickerbocker Hotels. The summer garden at the Plaza will open ne...

headline.main: NEW BUILDING DYNAMITED.; Second Explosion Follows Trouble Over Non-Union Labor Employed.

docs.abstract: Utah Hotel bldg framework dynamited following union dispute over use of non-union workers, Salt Lake City

headline.main: HOTEL MEN DINE IN SUNKEN GARDEN; Real Sod and Gravel Walks at Roman Feast That J.B. Regan Gives for Them. NOT $100 A PLATE FESTIVAL Unless the Price Refers to the Gold Plate the Food Was Served One -- Hotel Ballroom Transformed.

docs.lead_paragraph: James B. Regan, proprietor of the Hotel Knickerbocker, entertained sixty of his friends last night at a Roman feast, which was spread in the hotel ballroom. Conspicuous among the guests were the proprietors of nearly all the big hotels in this city. After the feast a vaudeville programme was given.

headline.main: BLOW AT LAWLESS SALOONS.; The Fourteen Will Attempt to Get Brewers to Withdraw Their Backing.

docs.abstract: Com of 14 enters into talks with brewing cos to have them withdraw backing of Raines law hotels
docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee of Fourteen, which was formed for the purpose of suppressing Raines law hotels, according to announcement made yesterday, has entered into negotiations with brewing concerns and surety companies with a view of establishing an "unofficial discretion" that would have the effect of preventing the opening of saloons or hotels of a disorderly character in the future.

headline.main: PLAN $1,000,000 HOTEL.; New Structure for White Plains to Have Many Novel Features.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., March 13. -- It was reported at White Plains to-day that a new hotel to cost $1,000,000 will be erected at Hartsdale, near White Plains, by a syndicate, and that it will be one of the finest in the world. Four hundred acres have been acquired, beginning at the Hartsdale railroad station, near the Scarsdale Golf Club grounds.

headline.main: THE RAINES LAW.; Mr. Funk Dissents from Views of Its Would-Be Amenders.

docs.abstract: I K Funk scores proposed amendments to NYS Raines law that regulates Sunday liquor sales in hotels and saloons, lr
docs.lead_paragraph: The Brewers' Association, the Committee of Fourteen, and others have agreed, if I am told correctly, to urge at Albany that the present Raines law be so amended as (1) to eliminate the compulsory bedrooms feature -- a most corrupting convenience; (2) to increase the license fee for Raines hotels, and (3) to grant local option to cities as a whole.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chicago Tribune complains of Chicago's lack of what it calls "first-rate hotels," splendid houses like a half dozen or more of the renowned modern hotels of New York, which themselves are supposed to attract visitors from all parts of the country. As a political convention city and a great business centre.

headline.main: SUING SUBSCRIBERS TO HOTEL NOT BUILT; Office Building Put Up on Fifth Avenue Site Where the Brunswick Was to Be. $500,000 WAS NOT PAID IN Knickerbocker Trust Company Brings the Suits -- Subscribers Balk at Shift in Plans.

docs.abstract: Knickerbocker Trust Co, Brunswick Hotel Co stock subscriber, sues co for failing to build planned hotel; office bldg was built on site instead
docs.lead_paragraph: Suit has been begun by the Knickerbocker Trust Company through its attorneys, Davies, Stone Auerbach, against several subscribers in the Brunswick Hotel Company for the collection of nearly $500,000 unpaid subscriptions, in that enterprise.
